```{r setup}
library(tidyverse)
library(p8105.datasets)

set.seed(1)
```

```{r}
data("nyc_airbnb")

nyc_airbnb = 
  nyc_airbnb %>% 
  mutate(stars = review_scores_location / 2) %>% 
  rename(
    borough = neighbourhood_group,
    neighborhood = neighbourhood) %>% 
  filter(borough != "Staten Island") %>% 
  select(price, stars, borough, neighborhood, room_type)
```

Visualizations 

```{r}
nyc_airbnb %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = stars, y = price)) + 
  geom_point()
```

Let's fit a linear model

```{r}
fit = lm(price ~ stars + borough, data = nyc_airbnb)
```

Let's look at this

```{r}
summary(fit)
summary(fit)$coef

fit %>% broom::tidy()
```

If you want to present output

```{r}
fit %>% 
  broom::tidy() %>% 
  mutate(term = str_replace(term, "borough", "Borough: ")) %>% 
  select(term, estimate, p.value) %>% 
  knitr::kable(digits = 3)
  
```

```{r}
modelr::add_residuals(nyc_airbnb, fit) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = stars, y = resid)) + 
  geom_point()

modelr::add_residuals(nyc_airbnb, fit) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = resid)) + 
  geom_density() +
  xlim(-200, 200)
```

## Interactions? Nesting? 
Let's try a different model

```{r}
fit = lm(price ~ stars + room_type, data = nyc_airbnb)

broom::tidy(fit)
```

Let's try nesting...

```{r}
nyc_airbnb %>% 
  relocate(borough) %>% 
  nest(data = price:room_type) %>% 
  mutate(
    lm_fits = map(.x = data, ~lm(price ~ stars + room_type, data = .x)), 
    lm_results = map(lm_fits, broom::tidy)
  ) %>% 
  select(borough, lm_results) %>% 
  unnest(lm_results) %>% 
  filter(term == "stars")
```

Look at neighborhoods in Manhattan

```{r}
manhattan_lm_results_df = 
nyc_airbnb %>% 
  filter(borough == "Manhattan") %>% 
  select(-borough) %>% 
  relocate(neighborhood) %>% 
  nest(data = price:room_type) %>% 
  mutate(
    lm_fits = map(.x = data, ~lm(price ~ stars + room_type, data = .x)), 
    lm_results = map(lm_fits, broom::tidy)
  ) %>% 
  select(neighborhood, lm_results) %>% 
  unnest(lm_results)

manhattan_lm_results_df %>% 
  filter(term == "stars") %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = estimate)) +
  geom_density()

manhattan_lm_results_df %>% 
  filter(str_detect(term, "room_type")) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = neighborhood, y = estimate)) +
  geom_point() +
  facet_grid(~term) +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust = 1))
```
